This document outlines some of the core styles for Swindon Car & Van and can be used as a toolkit when building the website. You can download the files used in this style guide by clicking the download button below.

Beautiful CSS3

A number of CSS3 styles are being used, such as gradients and rounded corners. Browsers that do not support these features will fallback to a more simply styled version.

Inspired by Bootstrap

The framework for this css has been heavily influenced by the excellent Twitter Bootstrap. To extend the styles for this site I would recommend checking it out.

Built using LESS css

It also uses LESS, a css pre-processor. LESS extends css with dynamic behavior such as variables, mixins, operations and functions which, once past the initial learning curve, will vastly improve and speed up the coding of your css. To find out more about why LESS is so great, why you should be using it, and instructions, check out this page on the Twitter Bootsrap site.

Get the files

Download Style Guide

If you have any questions please contact me@mattbailey.co and I will be happy to assist as best I can.

Notes:

The home icon uses the Font Awesome webfont (see below).

To highlight the current menu item add the class active to the li tag.

Buttons

      

      

      

Buttons with icons:

Notes:

For default button styling add the class btn to button or a tags.

Change the colours by adding the class btn-primary or btn-inverse.

Change the sizes by adding the class btn-large, btn-small or btn-mini.

For icons use the Font Awesome webfont (see below).

Forms

Please log in

Notes:

The same button styling rules apply as above.

To highlight the button area wrap it in a div with a class of form-actions.

Icons

.icon-home
.icon-truck
.icon-shopping-cart
.icon-wrench
.icon-pencil
.icon-envelope-alt
.icon-twitter
.icon-facebook-sign
.icon-user
.icon-thumbs-up
.icon-home
.icon-truck
.icon-shopping-cart
.icon-wrench
.icon-pencil
.icon-envelope-alt
.icon-twitter
.icon-facebook-sign
.icon-user
.icon-thumbs-up

Notes:

Icons use the free webfont Font Awesome

Icons require an empty i tag with a unique class prefixed with icon-, for example icon-home. You can place the i tag pretty much anywhere.

To the left are some examples of the icons available. See the Font Awesome website for full details.

To place the icon in a cirlce wrap the i tag in a span with a class of icon-circular.
